Welcome to ContactsApp’s documentation!¶

ContactsApp main¶

Main application entry point.

This module initializes the FastAPI application, sets up middleware, includes routers, and defines the startup event for initializing the rate limiter.

Attributes:

app (FastAPI): The main FastAPI application instance.

async main.read_item(current_user: UserDB = Depends(get_current_user))¶

A protected endpoint that requires authentication.

Parameters:

current_user (UserDB) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A message indicating that this is a secret router and the email of the owner.

Return type:

dict

async main.start()¶

Welcome endpoint.

Returns:

A welcome message.

Return type:

str

async main.startup()¶

Initializes the rate limiter by connecting to the Redis server.

ContactsApp repository Contacts¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (UserDB) – The user to create the contact for.

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(db: Session, db_contact, contact_id: int, user: UserDB)¶

Deletes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • db_contact (ContactDB) – The contact to delete.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • user (UserDB) – The user to delete the contact for.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (UserDB) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

Returns:

ContactsApp repository User¶

User repository module.

This module contains the functions to interact with the UserDB model in the database. It includes functions to get a user by email, create a new user, update a user’s token, confirm a user’s email, and update a user’s avatar.

async src.repository.user.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Marks a user’s email as confirmed.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to confirm.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

async src.repository.user.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → UserDB¶

Creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the new user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

UserDB

async src.repository.user.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → UserDB¶

Retrieves a user from the database by their email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the specified email, or None if the user does not exist.

Return type:

UserDB | None

async src.repository.user.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → UserDB¶

Updates the avatar for a user with the given email. Using the service Cloudinary This function retrieves the user by their email, updates their avatar URL, commits the changes to the database, and refreshes the user object to include the updated avatar URL.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user whose avatar is to be updated.

  • url (str) – The new URL of the avatar image.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

UserDB

async src.repository.user.update_token(user: UserDB, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (UserDB) – The user to update the token for.

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

ContactsApp routes Contacts¶

Contact routes module.

This module contains the FastAPI routes for the contact-related operations. It includes routes for creating, reading, updating, deleting, and searching contacts, as well as retrieving upcoming birthdays.

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: UserDB = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The data for the contact to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (UserDB) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: UserDB = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a contact with the specified ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (UserDB) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A success message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

async src.routes.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: UserDB = Depends(get_current_user))¶

  • current_user (UserDB) – The currently authenticated user.

ContactsApp routes User¶

User routes module.

This module contains the FastAPI routes for user-related operations. It includes routes for user signup, login, requesting email confirmation, refreshing tokens, confirming email, updating avatar, and retrieving the current user’s information.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The confirmation token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the verification fails.

async src.routes.user.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Log in a user.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The OAuth2 password request form.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is invalid, the email is not confirmed, or the password is invalid.

ContactsApp auth Auth¶

Authentication module.

This module contains the Auth class, which is responsible for handling authentication-related operations such as password hashing, token creation, token decoding, and user retrieval from the database.

class src.auth.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Authentication service class.

This class provides methods for password hashing, token creation, token decoding, and user retrieval from the database.

ALGORITHM = 'test'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'test'¶

ContactsApp service Email¶

Email Service Module.

This module contains the configuration for the email service and the function to send an email with a verification token.

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send an email with a verification token to the specified email address.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The email address to send the verification token to.

  • username (str) – The username associated with the email address.

  • host (str) – The host URL for the application.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an error connecting to the email server.

ContactsApp db DB¶

Database Module.

This module contains the configuration for the database connection, the session creation, and the base declarative class. It also includes a function to yield a database session that should be used as a dependency in FastAPI routes.

src.db.database.get_db()¶

Yield a database session that should be used as a dependency in FastAPI routes.

This function is a generator that creates a new SessionLocal instance for each request, and ensures that the session is closed after the request is finished. This is done using Python’s context manager (yield statement) and try/finally blocks.

Yield:

A database session.

Return type:

sqlalchemy.orm.Session

ContactsApp conf Config¶

Configuration Module.

This module contains the Settings class, which is used to load configuration values from environment variables or a .env file. It uses the pydantic_settings library to define the settings and load them from a .env file.

class src.conf.config.Settings(_case_sensitive: bool | None = None, _env_prefix: str | None = None, _env_file: DotenvType | None = WindowsPath('.'), _env_file_encoding: str | None = None, _env_ignore_empty: bool | None = None, _env_nested_delimiter: str | None = None, _env_parse_none_str: str | None = None, _secrets_dir: str | Path | None = None, *, sqlalchemy_database_url: str = 'postgresql+psycopg2://POSTGRES_USER:POSTGRES_PASSWORD@localhost:5432/POSTGRES_DB', secret_key: str = 'test', algorithm: str = 'test', mail_username: str = 'test', mail_password: str = 'test', mail_from: str = 'test', mail_port: int = 1, mail_server: str = 'test', redis_host: str = 'test', redis_port: int = 1, postgres_db: str = 'test', postgres_user: str = 'test', postgres_password: str = 'test', postgres_port: int = 5432, cloudinary_name: str = 'test', cloudinary_api_key: str = 'test', cloudinary_api_secret: str = 'test')¶

Bases: BaseSettings

Settings class for application configuration.

This class uses pydantic_settings to define settings that are loaded from environment variables or a .env file. The following settings are defined:

  • sqlalchemy_database_url: The URL for the SQLAlchemy database connection.

  • secret_key: The secret key for JWT encoding and decoding.

  • algorithm: The algorithm used for JWT encoding and decoding.

  • mail_username: The username for the email server.

  • mail_password: The password for the email server.

  • mail_from: The email address to send emails from.

  • mail_port: The port for the email server.

  • mail_server: The email server address.

  • redis_host: The host for the Redis server.

  • redis_port: The port for the Redis server.

  • postgres_db: The name of the PostgreSQL database.

  • postgres_user: The username for the PostgreSQL database.

  • postgres_password: The password for the PostgreSQL database.

  • postgres_port: The port for the PostgreSQL database.

  • cloudinary_name: The name of the Cloudinary account.

  • cloudinary_api_key: The API key for Cloudinary.

  • cloudinary_api_secret: The API secret for Cloudinary.

The settings are loaded from a .env file located in the root of the project.

class Config¶

Bases: object

Configuration class for pydantic_settings.

This class specifies the .env file to load settings from and the encoding of the .env file.

ContactsApp models Models¶

Database Models Module.

This module contains the SQLAlchemy models for the database tables.

class src.models.models.ContactDB(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

ContactDB model class.

This class represents the ‘contacts’ table in the database. It contains the following columns:

  • id: The primary key for the contact.

  • first_name: The first name of the contact.

  • last_name: The last name of the contact.

  • email: The email of the contact.

  • phone_number: The phone number of the contact.

  • birthday: The birthday of the contact.

  • additional_data: Additional data about the contact.

  • user_id: The foreign key linking the contact to a user.

  • user: The relationship to the UserDB model.

additional_data¶
birthday¶
email¶
first_name¶
id¶
last_name¶
phone_number¶
user¶
user_id¶
class src.models.models.UserDB(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

UserDB model class.

This class represents the ‘users’ table in the database. It contains the following columns:

  • id: The primary key for the user.

  • username: The username of the user.

  • email: The email of the user.

  • created_at: The date and time the user was created.

  • password: The hashed password of the user.

  • avatar: The URL of the user’s avatar.

  • refresh_token: The refresh token for the user.

  • confirmed: A boolean indicating whether the user’s email has been confirmed.

avatar¶
confirmed¶
created_at¶
email¶
id¶
password¶
refresh_token¶
username¶

ContactsApp schemas Schemas¶

Pydantic Schemas Module.

This module contains the Pydantic models for data validation and serialization.

class src.schemas.schemas.ContactBase(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, phone_number: str, birthday: date, additional_data: str | None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Base Pydantic model for Contact.

This model is used as a base for other Contact models and defines the common fields.

  • first_name: The first name of the contact.

  • last_name: The last name of the contact.

  • email: The email of the contact.

  • phone_number: The phone number of the contact.

  • birthday: The birthday of the contact.

  • additional_data: Additional data about the contact.

class src.schemas.schemas.ContactResponse(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, phone_number: str, birthday: date, additional_data: str | None, id: int)¶

Bases: ContactBase

Pydantic model for a Contact response.

This model inherits from ContactBase and adds an id field. It is used to define the response schema for a contact.

  • id: The id of the contact.

class src.schemas.schemas.UserDb(*, id: int, username: str, email: str, created_at: datetime, avatar: str)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Pydantic model for a User in the database.

This model defines the fields for a user in the database.

  • id: The id of the user.

  • username: The username of the user.

  • email: The email of the user.

  • created_at: The date and time the user was created.

  • avatar: The URL of the user’s avatar.
